Name: Regulating the use of mobile telephones while operating non-motorized transportation devices.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regulating the use of mobile telephones while operating non-motorized transportation devices.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Chapter one of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-171.2 to read as follows:
	§19-171.2  Non-motorized transportation devices.  a.  For the purposes of this section:     
“Non-motorized transportation device” shall mean a wheeled device propelled by human power and upon which a person or persons may ride.
b.  No person shall operate a non-motorized transportation device while using a mobile telephone unless that telephone is specifically designed and configured to allow hands-free listening and talking, and is used in that manner while operating a non-motorized transportation device.
c. A person who violates subdivision b of this section may be issued a notice of violation and shall be subject to a civil penalty of not more than fifty dollars.  
	§2.  This local law shall take effect ninety days after its enactment into law.



LS# 1521
9/9/10
JW
